revised_title: Fatigue Design Limitations and Materials Selection in Engineering
tldr: This article discusses the design implications for materials selection and the role of fatigue as a design limitation in engineering. It highlights the importance of understanding and addressing factors such as material variability, environmental conditions, and manufacturing defects to ensure the durability and reliability of engineered components. The author also explores various mechanical methods to improve fatigue strength, such as introducing beneficial residual stresses and optimizing bolted joints.
